SEARCH
Module org.example.syllllogysme
Package traitement

Class Proposition

java.lang.Object
traitement.Proposition
public class Proposition extends Object
The Proposition class represents a logical proposition in the context of syllogisms. It includes a first term, a second term, a quantifier, and an indicator of affirmation or negation. Propositions can be of four types: - A (universal affirmative) - E (universal negative) - I (existential affirmative) - O (existential negative)

  • Constructor Details

    • Proposition

      public Proposition(String premierTerme, String deuxiemeTerme, Quantificateur quantificateur, boolean estAffirmative)
      Constructor to create a new proposition.
      Parameters:
      premierTerme - The string representing the first term of the proposition.
      deuxiemeTerme - The string representing the second term of the proposition.
      quantificateur - The quantifier associated with the proposition (for example, universal or existential).
      estAffirmative - Indicates if the proposition is affirmative (true) or negative (false).
